snippet.textDisplay: A game I recently finished and very much enjoyed. Like Faxanadu before it, Xanadu Next is a spin-off in the Dragon Slayer series. It was first released in 2005 but finally made available worldwide on Steam in 2016. Before that, our only option was to play on the... N-Gage. It's actually the first time I ever put that console in my description! The gameplay is very enjoyabe and if you're familiar with the Ys series also from Falcom, then imagine Ys mixed with Diablo's "point and click" gameplay. This is the kind of addicting game that makes you want to do one more thing until it's suddenly way too late at night. This theme is great, gotta love the guitar.
snippet.textOriginal: A game I recently finished and very much enjoyed. Like Faxanadu before it, Xanadu Next is a spin-off in the Dragon Slayer series. It was first released in 2005 but finally made available worldwide on Steam in 2016. Before that, our only option was to play on the... N-Gage. It's actually the first time I ever put that console in my description! The gameplay is very enjoyabe and if you're familiar with the Ys series also from Falcom, then imagine Ys mixed with Diablo's "point and click" gameplay. This is the kind of addicting game that makes you want to do one more thing until it's suddenly way too late at night. This theme is great, gotta love the guitar.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm one of the few people that actually owned the original N-Gage and used it as a primary phone as well. To call it a console almost seems like a stretch given how lacklustre the gaming experience for it was.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm one of the few people that actually owned the original N-Gage and used it as a primary phone as well. To call it a console almost seems like a stretch given how lacklustre the gaming experience for it was.

snippet.textDisplay: @Joey Ford Fair point.
snippet.textOriginal: @Joey Ford Fair point.

snippet.textDisplay: @Burkhart von Klitzing Well look at the original Rayman, SD listed the Jaguar version in the game's uploads, despite the themes are from the PS1 version.
snippet.textOriginal: @Burkhart von Klitzing Well look at the original Rayman, SD listed the Jaguar version in the game's uploads, despite the themes are from the PS1 version.

snippet.textDisplay: @Joey Ford Sure, but that's not the point of SD listing game systems. He always only lists the systems whose versions of a game feature exactly the music track he uploads. And in the case of this vid, he made a mistake with that.
snippet.textOriginal: @Joey Ford Sure, but that's not the point of SD listing game systems. He always only lists the systems whose versions of a game feature exactly the music track he uploads. And in the case of this vid, he made a mistake with that.

snippet.textDisplay: @Burkhart von Klitzing Still, the game also came out for the N-Gage nonetheless.
snippet.textOriginal: @Burkhart von Klitzing Still, the game also came out for the N-Gage nonetheless.

snippet.textDisplay: The N-Gage game by the same name is a vastly different game, though, and the music sounded nothing like this. So to be in line with your channel up to this point, you really should have omitted the "N-Gage" in your description. Usually, you only list games and versions that ths specific upload really can be heard in.
snippet.textOriginal: The N-Gage game by the same name is a vastly different game, though, and the music sounded nothing like this. So to be in line with your channel up to this point, you really should have omitted the "N-Gage" in your description. Usually, you only list games and versions that ths specific upload really can be heard in.

snippet.textDisplay: I've been wanting to get this game.  Can anyone suggest if I should get this game on Steam or GOG?  I mostly use Steam (like 99.9999999999999% of the time), but the GOG  version is DRM-free.  Not sure which one to get.
snippet.textOriginal: I've been wanting to get this game.  Can anyone suggest if I should get this game on Steam or GOG?  I mostly use Steam (like 99.9999999999999% of the time), but the GOG  version is DRM-free.  Not sure which one to get.

snippet.textDisplay: @SupraDarky Thanks for the tip! :D
snippet.textOriginal: @SupraDarky Thanks for the tip! :D

snippet.textDisplay: It's all about your tolerance to DRM. I bought it on Steam and didn't have any problems. Something good to know, the resolution settings are not accessible inside the game directly but through a settings launcher inside the game's folder.
snippet.textOriginal: It's all about your tolerance to DRM. I bought it on Steam and didn't have any problems. Something good to know, the resolution settings are not accessible inside the game directly but through a settings launcher inside the game's folder.

snippet.textDisplay: I really need to play this game after this music.
snippet.textOriginal: I really need to play this game after this music.

snippet.textDisplay: This game is great, as expected of Falcom. The final dungeon is huge and confusing to navigate, but with every trip you get deeper and closer to the end. It's very satisfying.
snippet.textOriginal: This game is great, as expected of Falcom. The final dungeon is huge and confusing to navigate, but with every trip you get deeper and closer to the end. It's very satisfying.

snippet.textDisplay: Agreed. One thing I forgot to mention is how great the level design is. Its great use of shortcuts reminded me of the Souls series, connecting everything together.
snippet.textOriginal: Agreed. One thing I forgot to mention is how great the level design is. Its great use of shortcuts reminded me of the Souls series, connecting everything together.

snippet.textDisplay: Hey SupraDarky great VGM as always, i just wanted to tell you about a really great soundtrack. The game is called Petz Dogs 2 and yeah i know it sounds like a kids game and yes it is, but the composers did a surprisingly good job even though they didn't have too since it was for kids. Gongoro peak is one of my favorites. Its just a thought :)
snippet.textOriginal: Hey SupraDarky great VGM as always, i just wanted to tell you about a really great soundtrack. The game is called Petz Dogs 2 and yeah i know it sounds like a kids game and yes it is, but the composers did a surprisingly good job even though they didn't have too since it was for kids.
